etymology.description: phonetic: 婁(婁) (lóu, "bundle") + semantic: 攴(攴) (pū, "tap") = calculating by tapping or marking numbers -> number; count
etymology.interpretation: The character 数(數) (shù, "number; count") combines 婁(婁) (lóu, "bundle") as a phonetic component with 攴(攴) (pū, "tap") as the semantic component, reflecting the action of physically counting or tallying numbers.

examples.chinese: 妈妈教我数(媽媽教我數)，像一、二、三那样(像一、二、三那樣)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā jiào wǒ shù, xiàng yī, èr, sān nàyàng.
examples.english: Mom teaches me how to count, like one, two, three.

examples.chinese: 这个数很大(這個數很大)，使人难以计算(使人難以計算)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège shù hěn dà, shǐ rén nán yǐ jìsuàn.
examples.english: This number is huge, making it hard to calculate.
